title: 'I was found as a baby wrapped in my mum's coat – but who am I?'
description: For 70 years Tony May knew nothing about where he came from, except that he'd been left on the bank of the Thames.

title: Spain's monarchy shaken by Juan Carlos's hidden Swiss fortune
description: King Juan Carlos abdicated in 2014 but is once again in the spotlight over his financial dealings.

title: Coronavirus: My 86 days in hospital fighting Covid-19
description: Babak Khosrowshahi spent more than 12 weeks in hospital - he was determined to walk out a survivor.

title: Coronavirus face masks: Why men are less likely to wear masks
description: Covid-19 kills more men than women, so why are they shunning protective masks the most?

title: 'Weddings every day of the week' in 2021
description: The 2021 wedding season is likely to see a huge rise in midweek weddings as couples consider their options.

title: 'My Nigerian great-grandfather sold slaves'
description: The legacies of colonial slave-traders are being reassessed, but what about the Africans who profited?

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: So, did the Bradford choir have Covid-19 in January?
description: A Bradford choir that coughed in January gets the gold standard T-cell test - and is surprised by the result.

title: Coronavirus: The slow death of the American all-you-can-eat buffet
description: Buffets, beloved by many Americans, are rapidly changing their business model to adapt to the virus.

title: Samaritans: What it's like volunteering during lockdown
description: Volunteer Laura Bealin-Kelly says working at the charity is "the highlight of my week".

title: Coronavirus: Are mutations making it more infectious?
description: While there have been thousands of changes to the virus only one is seen as possibly altering its behaviour.

title: Coronavirus: 'When coffins lined the streets of my hometown'
description: Ecuadorean journalist Blanca Moncada was on the front line of the Covid-19 crisis in her town of Guayaquil.

title: The woman forced to flee her country for rapping.
description: Iranian rapper Justina tells her story from exile after facing jail in her country, where women are banned from singing solo.

title: Coronavirus: Women turn street food carts into disinfection units
description: Dozens of women in Afghanistan who were operating solar-powered food carts have had the vehicles converted into mobile disinfection units to help tackle coronavirus.

title: Care home pianist, 98, completes 100-day challenge
description: Rebecca Parker has raised more than £14,000 for Lanarkshire Health Board Endowment Funds since March.

title: Jofra Archer: England bowler fined and given written warning by ECB
description: England pace bowler Jofra Archer is fined and warned by the England and Wales Cricket Board for returning home between Tests.

title: Channel migrants: Nine boats arrive with 125 men and women on board
description: The first boat intercepted had 14 men on board, the Home Office says.

title: Nantes: Arson suspected in fire at Saint-Pierre-et-Saint-Paul cathedral
description: Prosecutors say three fires were started at the site, and are treating the blaze as a criminal act.

title: Sturgeon urges pub-goers not to 'drop their guard'
description: The warning from Nicola Sturgeon as Scotland heads into the first weekend of pubs being open indoors.

title: Coronavirus: Reassurance for travellers over cancelled holiday refunds
description: People given refund credit notes, not cash, for their cancelled package holiday are told their money is safe.

title: Twitter says hackers downloaded private account data
description: It says attackers copied records from up to eight hacked users, but none were "blue tick" accounts.

title: Coronavirus: Councils in England get new powers for local shutdowns
description: They can now target coronavirus outbreaks at local level, cancelling events and shutting premises.

title: Portland protests: Federal agents 'abuse power' in arrests
description: Men wearing camouflage and driving unmarked cars grabbed demonstrators without explanation.

title: Jessica Ennis-Hill: A personal guide through the magic of Olympic gold
description: It was an iconic moment. The 'face of the Games' triumphing on 'Super Saturday' at London 2012. Jessica Ennis-Hill looks back on gold.

title: US civil rights icon John Lewis dies
description: Lewis, who was the last of the Big Six civil rights leaders, was diagnosed with cancer in December.

title: Is it safe to sing yet?
description: Scientists are studying whether singers and musicians playing wind instruments can perform in public.

title: Obituary: Civil rights leader John Lewis
description: John Lewis forged his legacy as a champion for civil rights and racial equality in the 1960s.

title: The Papers: 'Normal by Christmas' and 'secret' royal wedding
description: Boris Johnson's optimistic plans to end coronavirus restrictions feature on several front pages.

title: Why I fell in love with Irish dancing
description: Morgan Bullock was accused of "cultural appropriation" after a video of her Irish dancing went viral.

title: Netflix Cursed: Could the cast survive medieval times?
description: As new medieval fantasy Cursed launches, we ask the cast how they'd have coped living in the past.

title: Coronavirus tests: Swabs don't damage the brain and other claims fact-checked
description: False rumours that coronavirus tests can be harmful have circulated in several different languages.
